definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: At last, a fundamental principle of efficient algorithm design by divide-and-conquer technique is established.
sentences.chinese: 最後得出了用分治術設計算法的一個基本原則。

sentences.english: Divide and conquer (D&C) is an important algorithm design paradigm based on multi-branched recursion.
sentences.chinese: 分治算法是基於多分枝遞歸的一種算法設計模式。

sentences.english: We should analyze the concept of the separate rule for the Hus and Hans again.
sentences.chinese: 對“胡漢分治”這一概念，則應作進一步的分析。

sentences.english: For divide and conquer, try to use the smallest scenarios to reproduce the problem.
sentences.chinese: 對於分治處理，可以嘗試使用最小場景來重現該問題。

definition: to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
separation of powers for checks and balances
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
to do things each in one's own way
